summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 between an FBI Senior Forensic Examiner and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York. The AUSA requests descriptions of electronic devices seized under a warrant in the Epstein investigation, and the examiner provides technical explanations, advising on which devices are necessary for forensic examination.

connections.description: The AUSA (M) is consulting with the FBI Senior Forensic Examiner regarding technical aspects of devices seized under a warrant, seeking advice on forensic examination.

events.title: Email consultation on seized devices
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails an FBI Senior Forensic Examiner to get descriptions of electronic devices seized under a warrant and to determine which require forensic search.

keyFacts: In September 2019, prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively seeking forensic examination of electronic devices seized under a warrant in the Epstein investigation.
The FBI Senior Forensic Examiner was consulted to identify and describe seized devices including computers, servers, storage arrays, and a cloud key device for accessing cloud data.
The examiner advised that most items were computers or large storage devices and that the 'cloud key' was critical for accessing data stored online.
The email chain is subject to a protective order, indicating the sensitive nature of the investigation and the devices involved.
